data.title: Jupiter house
data.text: We came here after a courthouse wedding to get some drinks. The service and the drinks were great, it also had a very nice atmosphere. The prices were fair as well.

data.title: The coffee is from another planet alright . . .
data.text:
And to be certain, it is no planet that you want to visit.  But if you insist on seeing what all the legitimate hubbub is about then be prepared:  
1. You can pay for bad coffee.
2. You can wait for one of the drifters that frequent the place to go postal, break a window and get tasered by Denton's finest.
3. You can leave your stuff on your table while you get up to go to the bathroom and return to find it missing/stolen.
4. You can (if you are an attractive lady) visit any weekday morning and have crusty, epicurean, 'stammtisch'-wanna-be old men who sit at a special table OGLE you and undress you with their eyes (coming and going).  Or sit close to this table and eavesdrop - you will find out just how corrupt Denton politics really are . . .
5. You can stand in line at the counter and watch as local self-important people who should know better effortlessly cut in front of you to get their special cup of 'I-am-more-important-than-you.' 

Yep, 'these are a few of my favorite' reasons NOT to visit the Jupiter House.

data.title: Excellent
data.text:
Wow a coffee stop with organic juice options and wheatgrass. :)

Their cold brew is out of this world!! Espresso beans soaked overnight to make this cold brew so amazing. Yum! A must try. 

The wheat grass and organic pineapple shooter was wonderful.

data.title: Nice local placw
data.text: Right on the courthouse square. Free wifi and great drinks. Big friendly place with lots of local artwork. Small town college store that stands out

data.title: Great place for coffee and to visit!
data.text: A quaint coffee shop that also offers other beverages and homemade snacks. Quiet shop and lots of places to sit. Open 6 am to 12 am, so it's almost 24 hours!

data.title: Yum
data.text: We just arrived from the airport and surprised my mother in law at this cool coffee house. Coffee is rich, aromatic and delicious.  Great ambiance that you would could find in a big city like NY. I also tried the blueberry mango smoothie. Excellent.

data.title: Smooth smoothie.
data.text: Wife and I were cruisin courthouse square and the shops and strolled into the Jupiter House.  At first it was so busy we walked out and came back 1/2 hr later.  No line.  Order 2 smoothies which were very good.  Oh and a bran muffin.  Try it.

data.title: Best latte in town
data.text:
I have been faithful to Jupiter House over the years.  It was one of the first coffee houses to make it in Denton.  After a trip to Dallas over the weekend experiencing some of what the city had to offer for coffee I could not wait to get back to Denton.  Jupiter had true baristas that craft the coffee drinks and not only are they artistic creations, they taste fantastic.  I went Flying Horse cafe in the Magnolia, and though it is super cute and has great mugs my latte was terrible.  Scalding hot and no flavor.  Yuck.
Hats off to Joey and Amy and their fabulous staff!

data.title: Fun Casual Atmosphere, Good Coffee, Right on the Square
data.text:
I really love the hip, casual atmosphere in this cafe.  The coffee and espresso drinks are very good and are made in the traditional ways.  They pour out a real nice espresso shot.  Smoothie drinks are served as well as coffee beverages.  They have lots of tables with power outlets so people can come with laptops to study.  I also see lots of people reading books and newspapers on the comfortable sofas.  Others grab a coffee 'to-go' before wandering around the square.

The snacks are yummy and definitely less 'mass-produced' than most cafe's.  You should note that their flavored drinks (like lattes and mochas) have less sweetening than Starbucks and other cafe chains.  If you prefer your drinks 'sweet,' you should probably ask for double vanilla (or other flavor).

There is also outside seating.  I usually see at least one well-behaved dog sitting outside with their owners who are enjoying a nice coffee on a sunny day.  

If you are vegetarian or vegan, you'll have a lot of options here.  Not only do they offer many milk alternatives, many of the snacks are vegan, vegetarian, and/or organic.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: Simply amazing coffee (and I live in Starbucks land in Seattle). Cool vibe. I also tried one of their banana walnut muffins and it was very good.

data.title: My favorite place in Denton
data.text: The coffee is good, the food options are good, the smoothies are good and the folks are friendly.  The line can move slow at times, but don't go there in a rush.  Get a muffin or bagel and you won't regret it.  Love the service, love the drinks and eats, love the art, and love the vibe.  Excellent place.

data.title: Fun little coffee shop
data.text: I havent been here in quite some time but I do like to swing in and grab a cup on my way around the square. Always good coffee and snacks

data.title: Best coffee
data.text:
Awesome coffee. Always hot and strong.  It's nice to have a place nearby that sells great codes, but isn't a Starbucks.

Free wifi and variety of snacks is also a bonus.

data.title: Great coffee
data.text: Jupiter House is a perfect slice of Denton. In the afternoons and evenings students are flowing in and out. If you want to be among the older Dentonite population, go early on weekend mornings.

data.title: Cute little coffee house
data.text: Great coffee and baked goods.  Lots of seating and places to read or get on your computer.  Good place to people watch!

data.title: Coffee that rocks
data.text: We loved our 2 visits to this coffee shop! It compares well with some of our best coffee stops in our travels. It would be a lock for top 5 if we had not had some stale baked goods on our last visit - the prior visit the baked goods were fresh. This is not the primary reason we were there though - it was for the great coffee, service and atmosphere in equal doses! The espresso latte was perfect and the coffee selections on the self serve bar were great! If only they could find another baker or at least get rid of the stale stuff so we didn't buy it. Fresh baked goods and the place would totally Rock!!!

data.title: Amazing place
data.text: I love coming here the atmosphere always seems friendly and welcoming. The zucchini bread is wonderful I get it everytime I go. The coffee is really good too. Has a hipster/indie feel, and it's a great place to go with friends.

data.title: Great little coffee shop on the square
data.text: Jupiter House is a nice, quiet coffee house on the square in downtown Denton. Free wifi, various types of coffee, other beverages and baked goods are available. Starbucks it is not (thankfully!) Lots of locals and students stop in for conversation or study. Jupiter House is conducive to both. It is a good spot to pass the time away alone or with a friend.

data.title: OJ
data.text: Love their fresh, hand squeezed orange juice...on ice if you ask.  Great locally owned coffee shop.  View of the old courthouse too.

data.title: Not for everyone
data.text: If you are a penniless college student needing free Wi-Fi, a homeless person requiring water or a bathroom, or a smoker needing space, this is the coffee house for you. If, however, you expect more from your barista than your change being thrown at you, or an inability to create a latte without your assistance, you may need to go elsewhere.
